supporting_quotes: Alma mater: University of Zurich

roles: Member of the Swiss National Council
supporting_quotes: Leuthard was a member of the Swiss National Council from 1999 to 2006 for the canton of Aargau.
She presided over the Christian Democratic People's Party from 2004 to 2006.

roles: Member of the Swiss Federal Council
fifth woman elected to the Federal Council
supporting_quotes: Following the resignation of Joseph Deiss from the Swiss Federal Council, Leuthard was elected as his successor on 14 June 2006. She received 133 out of 234 valid votes to become the 109th Federal Councillor.
Member of the Swiss Federal Council In office 1 August 2006 – 31 December 2018

roles: Head of the Department of Economic Affairs
supporting_quotes: From 1 August 2006 until 31 October 2010, she was head of the Federal Department of Economic Affairs.
Head of the Department of Economic Affairs In office 1 August 2006 – 31 October 2010
For the calendar year 2009, Leuthard was elected Vice President of the Swiss Confederation
Vice President of Switzerland In office 1 January 2009 – 31 December 2009

roles: third woman to hold the post
supporting_quotes: She was elected President of the Confederation for 2010 and 2017.
She became the third woman to hold the post, after Ruth Dreifuss (1999) and Micheline Calmy-Rey (2007).
President of Switzerland In office 1 January 2010 – 31 December 2010

organizations: Federal Department of Environment, Transport, Energy and Communications
roles: Head of the Department of Environment, Transport, Energy and Communications
supporting_quotes: On 1 November 2010 she became head of the Federal Department of Environment, Transport, Energy and Communications, succeeding Moritz Leuenberger.
Head of the Department of Environment, Transport, Energy and Communications In office 1 November 2010 – 31 December 2018
Vice President of Switzerland In office 1 January 2016 – 31 December 2016
She was elected President of the Confederation for 2010 and 2017.
President of Switzerland In office 1 January 2017 – 31 December 2017

roles: member of the High-level Panel on Digital Cooperation
supporting_quotes: In her capacity as minister, she was appointed by United Nations Secretary General António Guterres in 2018 to the High-level Panel on Digital Cooperation, co-chaired by Melinda Gates and Jack Ma.
As of 19 December 2019 she is a member of the board of the Kofi Annan Foundation
As of 19 December 2019 she is a member of the board of the Kofi Annan Foundation and Stadler Rail.
